intro: Hypochaeris variegata, commonly known as the variegated hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and features basal leaves that are elongated and often hairy. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hypochaeris variegata is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in some regions.
